A4.text: Redskin (1929) and The Mysterious Island (1929) were photographed almost entirely in Technicolor Process 3.

A5.text: Kinemacolor, the first commercially successful cinematographic colour process, produced films in two colours (red and cyan) from 1908 to 1914.

A6.text: Color in cinema: Circa 80 percent of the films of the 1890s to the 1920s had colours.
